headline: Preserved Lemons

reviewedBy.name: Delish Test Kitchen
reviewedBy.description: Delish is known for developing the most creative and outrageously good food on the planet. Each recipe is meticulously tested and perfected by our team of culinary experts, ensuring they’ll always be completely foolproof and totally fun.

description: This preserved lemons recipe will elongate their shelf life and enhance many of your meals in the best way possible.

author.name: Francesca Zani
author.description:
Expertise: Italian Cuisine, Italian-American cuisine, American fusion, recipe development, travel, dining culture, social media, food styling, video producing  

Education: Associate's degree in Culinary Arts, Bachelor's degree in Applied Food Studies with a concentration in Italian Cuisine from The Culinary Institute of America  About Me: As an assistant food editor at Delish, Francesca hosts on-site video recipes and collaborates with the food and community teams to develop, produce, and style social video recipes. She is responsible for styling many of Delish’s widely popular TikTok and IG recipe videos, including Chips Ahoy cookie pops, Cranberry brie bites, and Thanksgiving crunch wraps, which have garnered over 25M views. Francesca loves dining out at top-rated NYC and Hudson Valley restaurants. She also loves traveling to food cities near and far that often spark creativity and social media/ blog content. She loves sipping lattes, sending hilarious memes to friends, photographing her silly beagle, Carmine, and crocheting.
See more at https://francescazani.com/ and https://www.thegarnishedpalate.com/

name: Preserved Lemons

recipeInstructions.text: For long preserve: Cut 4 lemons into quarters lengthwise, leaving bottom intact. Transfer lemons to a large bowl and sprinkle 1/2 cup salt inside of lemons. Transfer lemons to a sterilized 32-ounce (1- quart) Mason jar; reserve bowl with salt.
Using a pestle or rounded object such as the handle of a rolling pin, press lemons down into jar, expelling some juice.

Into reserved bowl, squeeze juice of remaining 4 lemons, stir to combine, and add to jar. Add more lemon juice or water to cover lemons, if needed. Add cinnamon, peppercorns, and star anise, if using.
Seal jar and flip a few times to ensure lemons are submerged.
Let sit at room temperature until rinds are softened and barely translucent, 2 to 3 weeks.
For quick preserve: In a medium pot over medium heat, heat juice of 4 lemons, 1/4 cup water, and 1/4 cup salt just until salt dissolves and liquid comes to a simmer, 2 to 3 minutes.
Cut ends off remaining 4 lemons, then slice 1/4" thick. Transfer lemon slices to a sterilized 32-ounce (1-quart) Mason jar.

Using a pestle or rounded object such as the handle of a rolling pin, press lemons down into jar, expelling some juice. Pour hot liquid over and let cool slightly. Add cinnamon, peppercorns, and star anise, if using.
Seal jar and flip a few times to ensure lemons are submerged.
Let sit at room temperature 1 day, then refrigerate until ready to use.
